there's also some things you don't do
when you come here and so that's why
today we have for you are the don'ts of

don't for you it's actually kind of a
serious but fun one is don't come to
turks and caicos unless you're ready to
relax
this place is about
beach
relax repeat
beach relax repeat if you can't do that
if you want to hit a bunch of museums

reset kind of thing so i want to get

now
probably the first don't you'll actually
come across when you actually do come to
turks and caicos is actually if you're
flying in and my dome for that would be
once your plane lands don't dawdle on
the plane you want to get to passport
control as fast as you can because
passport control at providenciales the
provo it could take some time it's a bit
slow and the thing is if you're coming
with multiple planes and you get behind
them you could spend quite a bit of time
in that line so i will tell you to don't
dawdle hurry up through there okay now
the thing is a lot of people what they
do is they don't fly and they might come
with their cruise ship and go off at

don't really worry about that but here
you don't want a dollar you want to kind
of hurry up through go to the bathroom
after you get through customs okay well
unless you're like you see the line
maybe go before you get there but it
will take some time okay now when you're
getting out of the airport you might
wonder is hey how do i how do i get
around town where am i going to go well
one of the things i want to tell you is
don't count on public transportation
when you're here in turks and caicos
because there isn't any there is no
public transport there's no bus system
and stuff like that that you can do
that's really cheap and stuff like that
so you're going to be taking taxis
you're going to be renting a car you're
going to be you know you're borrowing
bikes from your accommodation and stuff
like that you can take ferries and boats
and stuff like that but you got to pay
for everything so you got to think about
that when you are coming here so what
will usually happen is you're going to
be taking taxes a lot of the times and
my next don't for you is don't have a
heart attack when they give you the
price for the taxis because a lot of
times the taxi prices are they're quite
high here i'll just tell you that right
now but also the prices are sometimes
per person so you're like oh bye
for a 15 minute ride that's how much it
is oh yes that's how much it is and
that's what you're gonna pay so make
sure you're talking to the taxi driver
before you get in so you're kind of
prepared for when you get out what
you're going to pay just so you know
that also don't expect credit cards to
be taken by the taxis they'll be taken
pretty much everywhere else but maybe
not in the taxi so you need to have some
cash when you're here and what's cool is
you don't have to worry too much about
the cashier because they use the us
dollar here in turks and caicos which is
awesome the atms here spit out dollars
you're coming from the u.s just bring
cash with you so you're ready to go
because i haven't seen a ton of atms
around so you might want to bring some
when you do come here okay now going
back to the taxi kind of stuff and
getting around another don't i'll have
for you is don't be surprised if there's
other people in your taxi when you come
here because it's per person so you're
like paying for that one spot and since
a lot of them are bigger vans they might
take multiple people so don't be
surprised there's someone else going
along with you or they might have a
friend with them in the front seat it's
kind of a normal thing so don't freak
out about it and the thing is some
people when they come they say you know
what i don't want to spend all this
money on you know taxis and this kind of
stuff maybe they want to rent a car and
you can rent a car here and if you're
going to drive a lot for a day actually
i would rent a car just for the day
because it'll be cheaper than taking
taxis everywhere but i have to tell you
don't forget they drive on the left here
look turks and caicos we're in the
british west indies this is a former
british colony and they drive on the
left and the thing that might throw you
off when you're here is some of the cars
are like they are in england where the
driver is on the right side but then
some of the cars are from the us and
there are drivers on the left side and
that can really throw you off so make
sure when you're driving or riding your
bike you're always staying to the left
and if you're crossing the street always
look right first and then left because
things are going by okay and the thing

ordering your drinks waiting for your

whether you're driving or riding a bike
or something like that
are the speed bumps here i mean these

be like whoa
like that so do have a heads up for it

what you think is a dinner menu price is
probably the lunch menu price here so
usually like dinner entrees or like 40
bucks and lunch entrees are about 20
bucks and it does add up quickly because
we're here on an island a very popular
tourist island and the thing is they
can't get a lot of the supplies here in
big bulk so that raises the price quite
a bit so you will pay a lot but the
thing is is everywhere we've gone
whether it's been restaurants whether
it's been tours accommodation where
we've stayed and stuff like that we may
be paying a higher price but we've been
very happy with the service we had from
the people the food we've eaten the
accommodation we've had the tours we had
so it is expensive but you don't feel
like you're really getting ripped off by
it which is a really nice thing and
another thing i kind of would add to

don't think that the price tag is the

you can sometimes negotiate those prices
so you can change it that way some of

but what i want to say is by not having
to set prices here in turks and caicos
they actually add the sales tax on after

bill you should calculate how much
you're gonna pay before you get your

10 or a little bit more because the

you will do that because that's i mean
that's how people make their living here
but i will say you do need to make sure

sometimes they'll actually charge the

those restaurants you're tipping at is
